attributes.action: Not Reduce the National Minimum Wage in Nothern Ireland!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Plans as reported in the BBC Northern Ireland Website 24 July that: "Prime Minister Gordon Brown is considering plans which could see the minimum wage reduced in Northern Ireland, it is believed."

This is discrimination against a whole part of the UK that the people of Northern Ireland should not stand for.  Already Northern Ireland puts up with a far lower wage than the rest of the mainland, whilst our house prices soar faster than anywhere else in the UK.  If you want to invest in peace why then deny the people the right to a fair wage?  

Why should the worth of workers in England be more than those of Northern Ireland when we are contributing to the same economy?
